courseDescription:
App Inventor 2 is a great way to learn programming principles and start your journey towards an Android development career. This innovative software contains two user interface tools, the designer and the editor, that make building applications uncomplicated. The program enables anybody to create apps for smartphones and tablets from the ground up. Its designer section lets users integrate the components by dragging objects like puzzle pieces instead of writing complex Java. This course will teach you all you need to know about developing game applications. In addition, the lessons offer a deeper comprehension of the block programming method utilized by App Inventor 2 in creating mobile applications. If you've never programmed before, this course is for you. It also helps professional app developers who want to look at things differently.

Explore how to build a full Pong game from the ground up and become acquainted with the essential components and sensors that will serve as the foundation for the game's architecture. Learn all you need about programming layouts and major built-in features like control, procedures and initializers. You'll also discover how to configure the accelerometer to handle movement and speed data. Next, customize the settings for the Ping Pong game, such as colors, the ball track and the paddle movement. Later, you will visualize the building process for configuring the game mode screen. Finally, we provide some tips on customizing the paddle. As you progress, you will gain skills in integrating dynamic buttons, label components, layouts and toggle groups to forge the game options and the setting screens.

After completing this program, you will have created an iconic Android app: Pong. The method employs short, in-depth video lectures to help you learn App Inventor 2 at home. Master the software's core functions, such as the designer and the editor, to learn how to program more successfully. Know how to configure control, procedures, logic, mathematics, list, color, logic and variable blocks in the Block Editor. You will utilize the App Inventor 2 canvas, buttons, arrangement, storage and sensor elements. We will arm you with valuable ideas and suggestions for releasing your app on Google Play. Use App Inventor 2 to develop Android apps and upload the APK project files to Google Play. You're almost a member of the twenty-first century's computer programming elite. Register now!
